conversation_context.reason_for_visit: Behavioral concerns at home and school; difficulties with peer relationships

patient_background.living_situation: Lives with mother and stepfather (parents divorced when she was 4)
patient_background.medical_history: History of frequent ear infections in early childhood

social_communication_deficits: Difficulty sustaining friendships despite multiple attempts
Often misinterprets peers' intentions (perceives teasing when none intended)
Struggles with group activities and unstructured social time
Limited understanding of personal space boundaries
Difficulty with reciprocal conversation
restricted_repetitive_behaviors: Strong interest in collecting and organizing rocks by color and size
Rigid adherence to rules; becomes upset when others don't follow them
Distress with unexpected changes to routine
Sensory sensitivity to clothing tags, food textures
Hand flapping when excited
symptoms_and_experiences.duration: Became more apparent after starting elementary school
symptoms_and_experiences.impact_on_life: Increasing social isolation; emotional outbursts at school

thoughts: Believes others are mean to her
feelings: Anger when social overtures are rejected

social_interactions: Approaches peers but interaction style often leads to rejection
Plays alongside rather than with peers
More comfortable with adults or younger children
interventions: Social skills lunch group at school

matching_criteria: Persistent deficits in social communication
Restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior
Symptoms present in early developmental period but fully apparent with social demands
Symptoms cause significant impairment
Presentation consistent with autism in girls (social motivation despite difficulties)

conversation_context.reason_for_visit: Evaluation for social difficulties and behavioral rigidity

patient_background.living_situation: Lives with mother and maternal grandparents
patient_background.medical_history: History of motor coordination issues, receiving physical therapy

social_communication_deficits: Difficulty initiating and maintaining peer relationships
Overly formal and pedantic speech patterns
Struggles to understand humor, idioms, and metaphors
Limited understanding of personal space and social boundaries
Difficulty identifying and responding to others' emotional states
restricted_repetitive_behaviors: Intense interest in geography and maps
Can name capital cities of all countries and their populations
Becomes highly distressed with last-minute changes to plans
Strict adherence to specific morning and bedtime routines
Strong sensory aversions to certain food textures and loud environments
symptoms_and_experiences.duration: Present since early childhood but more problematic since starting middle school
symptoms_and_experiences.impact_on_life: Academic performance inconsistent despite areas of strength; increasing peer rejection

thoughts: Concerned about upcoming school field trip schedule changes
Difficulty understanding why peers find his interests 'boring'
feelings: Frustration when unable to engage others in his interests
Pride in his exceptional knowledge of geography

daily_activities: Spends hours drawing detailed maps and memorizing statistics
Becomes upset if routines are disrupted
social_interactions: Attempts to interact with peers but approach is often one-sided
Prefers structured activities with clear rules
Frequently corrects others' factual errors, causing social friction
More comfortable interacting with adults than peers

matching_criteria: Persistent deficits in social communication and interaction
Restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior and interests
Symptoms present in early developmental period
Symptoms cause significant impairment in social functioning
Not better explained by intellectual disability or global developmental delay

conversation_context.reason_for_visit: Pediatrician referral for evaluation of language delay and unusual behaviors

patient_background.living_situation: Lives with both parents and infant sister
patient_background.medical_history: Frequent ear infections in infancy, otherwise healthy

social_communication_deficits: Limited spoken language (uses 1-2 word phrases)
Rarely responds to name consistently
Limited joint attention (doesn't point to show interest)
Minimal eye contact during interactions
Does not engage in pretend play with others
restricted_repetitive_behaviors: Lines up toys in precise rows repeatedly
Strong attachment to unusual objects (carries a specific plastic spoon everywhere)
Rigid adherence to specific routines
Hand flapping when excited
Unusual interest in parts of objects (spinning wheels, opening/closing doors)
symptoms_and_experiences.duration: Concerns first noted around 18 months of age
symptoms_and_experiences.impact_on_life: Significant difficulties in kindergarten participation; challenges in family outings

emotional_state.current_mood: Generally content when engaged in preferred activities
thoughts: Difficult to assess due to language limitations
Limited awareness of others' emotional states

daily_activities: Engages in solitary play with restricted interests
Requires significant support for self-care activities
social_interactions: Uses adults instrumentally (leads them by hand to obtain wants)
interventions: Receiving special education services in kindergarten

matching_criteria: Persistent deficits in social communication across contexts
Restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior
Symptoms present in early developmental period
Symptoms cause significant functional impairment
Not better explained by intellectual disability alone

conversation_context.reason_for_visit: Self-referral after reading about autism in women; history of anxiety and social difficulties

patient_background.family_history: Mother with anxiety disorder; cousin with ADHD
patient_background.medical_history: Multiple diagnoses including anxiety, depression, and 'social phobia' throughout adulthood

social_communication_deficits: Difficulty with unstructured social interactions despite strong verbal skills
Challenges reading subtle social cues and nonverbal communication
Tendency toward literal interpretation of language
Exhaustion after social interactions ('social hangover')
Difficulty maintaining friendships despite intellectual understanding of social rules
restricted_repetitive_behaviors: Intense special interests that have evolved over time (currently historical architecture)
Strong need for routine and predictability
Sensory sensitivities (particularly to sounds and clothing textures)
Subtle self-stimulatory behaviors (pen clicking, hair twirling) during stress
Precise organizational systems that must be maintained
symptoms_and_experiences.duration: Lifelong difficulties, but compensated through intelligence and 'masking'
symptoms_and_experiences.severity: Mild, with substantial learned coping strategies
symptoms_and_experiences.impact_on_life: History of burnout from camouflaging; difficulties with romantic relationships; career success but interpersonal challenges in workplace

thoughts: Seeking explanation for lifelong sense of 'differentness'
Analyzing past social difficulties through new lens
Relief at finding potential explanation for struggles

daily_activities: Highly structured daily routine with significant distress if disrupted
Works remotely to manage sensory environment
Requires extended recovery time after social events
Detailed special interest research in free time
social_interactions: Has developed 'scripts' for common social situations
Difficulty navigating office politics and unwritten rules
interventions: Self-taught coping strategies for sensory issues
Online support communities for autistic adults

matching_criteria: Persistent pattern of social communication differences
Restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior
Early developmental history consistent with autism
Significant masking/compensation typical of females with autism
Symptoms cause significant challenges despite excellent compensation

conversation_context.reason_for_visit: School suggested evaluation for social difficulties and focus issues

patient_background.living_situation: Lives with both parents and older sibling
patient_background.family_history: Father and paternal uncle with ADHD

social_communication_deficits: Difficulty sustaining attention during conversations
Interrupts others frequently
Challenges waiting turn in groups
Sometimes misses social cues when excited or distracted
May not follow through on multi-step instructions
restricted_repetitive_behaviors: Strong interests in dinosaurs and space (age-appropriate topics)
Fidgets frequently but not in stereotyped patterns
Difficulty remaining seated during non-preferred activities
Some sensory seeking behaviors (movement, tactile input)
Resists transitions when engaged in preferred activities
symptoms_and_experiences.severity: Mild to moderate attention and behavioral challenges
symptoms_and_experiences.impact_on_life: Academic performance below potential; some peer conflicts

daily_activities: High activity level throughout the day
Difficulty with sustained mental effort for non-preferred tasks
social_interactions: Has several friendships despite occasional conflicts
Shows appropriate range of facial expressions
Demonstrates joint attention and social reciprocity when focused

matching_criteria: Social difficulties better explained by attention deficits and impulsivity
Behavior patterns consistent with ADHD rather than autism
Shows age-appropriate social reciprocity when engaged
Demonstrates empathy and social motivation
Symptoms better explained by Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder
